reviews.text: Having grown up in Pittsburgh, I've visited once or twice a year and saw the Sunnyledge emerge as an upscale bed and breakfast with a really fine restaurant. A couple of years after it opened, a friend and I had dinner there and loved it.
reviews.title: Has really gone downhill...

reviews.text: I hadn't been to the city for three years, when I needed a hotel for a recent visit. I read the not so good reviews, but thought I'd try it for two or three nights. The location, on Fifth Ave. in Shadyside, is excellent, and I remembered how impressive the converted mansion was. Unfortunately, the property has really gone downhill. My daughter and I walked into a dark, dingy, musty smelling atmosphere. Tables were formally set in the old dining room, but I never saw a person there. The bar, too, did not have a living soul on a stool (to my knowledge) during the 2 nights I was there.
reviews.title: Great Martini Bar

reviews.text: I was 'upgraded' to a larger room. Yes, it was grand in size, with a huge, high four-postered bed. The mildew odor was overwhelming. A fifty dollar 'minibar' surcharge was added, for a minibar that held three cans of soda and juice.
reviews.title: Sunnyledge is a good buy!

reviews.text: I felt safe and comfortable enough to stay for the two nights. It was certainly very private. The breakfast was arranged beautifully, but the coffee was metallic smelling and the mellon chunks tasteless. Some of the staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Beautiful room nice staff!

reviews.text: I have not stayed at the hotel but will in the future. We stopped in when we saw the sign for the martini bar. There were four of us so we sampled a number of them and liked them all. It was Saturday evening and the owner was working the bar, we had a great conversation and will definitely be back. The house is beautiful with wonderful woodwork throughout.
reviews.title: Sunnyledge visit was a deal +
